title: Spack broken out of the box on Cray (cle6.0).
body:
Cloning the most current version of spack onto a Cray machine with OS cle6.0 results in the following error: 
```console
$ share/spack/setup-env.sh 
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/spack/bin/spack", line 63, in <module>
    import spack.main  # noqa
  File "/spack/lib/spack/spack/main.py", line 28, in <module>
    import spack.architecture
  File "/spack/lib/spack/spack/architecture.py", line 68, in <module>
    import spack.compiler
  File "/spack/lib/spack/spack/compiler.py", line 18, in <module>
    import spack.spec
  File "/spack/lib/spack/spack/spec.py", line 106, in <module>
    import spack.repo
  File "/spack/lib/spack/spack/repo.py", line 36, in <module>
    import spack.caches
  File "/spack/lib/spack/spack/caches.py", line 14, in <module>
    import spack.fetch_strategy
  File "/spack/lib/spack/spack/fetch_strategy.py", line 30, in <module>
    import xml.etree.ElementTree
  File "/usr/lib64/python3.4/_import_failed/xml.py", line 17, in <module>
    to install it.""".format(__name__, package))
ImportError: Module 'xml' is not installed.
Use:
  sudo zypper install python3
to install it.
```
I can work around this by unloading python2 and appending python 3 to my path. On `cle7` and `toss3` machines python2 works fine and spack runs normally without having to change this.  </br>
Any recommendations would be appreciated.
